column5: I looked on line and it says municipal parking for $15 a day. My question is where to park with lake access? I have never been to Downtown Barrie and I want to bring a buddy who's never been ice fishing in Ontario. He's a Nova Scotia boy. Any advice is greatly appreciated

If you drive down town barrie, you can't miss the lots.  There are numerous lots around the lakeshore.  Just look for the one closest to the groups of huts...  If you look on the city of barrie website, you can likely find a map of all the parking lots down town.
Is the season closed now for retrolift?
I like that area for pike and perch after the white fish season closes Albert. It,s a long walk to deep water from that lot.  PM sent to ya T 52
Can't you park on sidestreets after 7am?  As long is there is no weather coming?  I believe there is no overnight parking allowed.  (wouldn't want any visitors?)

They have posted no parking at one well known area, but I seen no tickets on any of the cars or trucks. All other areas I know really dont have road access here. Parking lots that charge $15 for a day or $3 an hour.
